p: Total flavonoid contents (TFC) greatly varied among the honeys. Although manuka honey contained a higher TFC (3.9 mg/100 g) than many natural honeys (0.47–3.61 and 2.0–5.4 mg/100 g honey) [ 40, 52], its TFC was similar to guggul honey (4.1 mg/100 g) and much lower than that of arjuna and olive honeys (15.3 and 24.0 mg/100 g, respectively), whereas jiaogulan honey had the lowest TFC (2.1 mg/100 g). The results confirmed TPC and TFC of honeys vary and they are strongly determined by nectar sources.
